original_data.question: A student studying pharmacology is a member of a team that is conducting research related to the elimination of multiple anticoagulant medications. His duty as a member of the team is to collect serum samples of the subjects every 4 hours and send them for analysis of serum drug levels. He is also supposed to collect, document and analyze the data. For one of the subjects, he notices that the subject is eliminating 0.5 mg of the drug every 4 hours. Which of the following anticoagulants did this patient most likely consume?

model_response:
The half-life of warfarin is 36 hours. The half-life of enoxaparin is 2.7 hours. The half-life of fondaparinux is 17.5 hours. The half-life of apixaban is 9-11 hours.

Answer: OPTION A IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Individuals enrolled in a school or formal educational program.
The study of the origin, nature, properties, and actions of drugs and their effects on living organisms.

Critical and exhaustive investigation or experimentation, having for its aim the discovery of new facts and their correct interpretation, the revision of accepted conclusions, theories, or laws in the light of newly discovered facts, or the practical application of such new or revised conclusions, theories, or laws. (Webster, 3d ed)
The elimination by an organism of the waste products that arise as a result of metabolic activity. These products include water, carbon dioxide (CO2), and nitrogenous compounds. [ISBN:0192801023]
An indefinite large quantity that is considered to be greater than several.
Agents that prevent BLOOD CLOTTING.
Two or more people working together.
A sample of serum collected for analysis.
Persons who are enrolled in research studies or who are otherwise the subjects of research.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
A quantitative measurement of the amount of aspartate aminotransferase present in a sample of serum.
Any device designed to perform an analysis.
A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.
Persons who are enrolled in research studies or who are otherwise the subjects of research.
A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.
Drugs intended for human or veterinary use, presented in their finished dosage form. Included here are materials used in the preparation and/or formulation of the finished dosage form.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
Agents that prevent BLOOD CLOTTING.
